summary: This is an email from July 27, 2019, forwarding a news article about Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, Michael Thomas, who claims to have saved Epstein from a suicide attempt by hanging. The email includes Thomas's professional contact information as a Material Handler Supervisor at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.role: Material Handler Supervisor at Metropolitan Correctional Center, Epstein's ex-cop cellmate
persons.context: Identified as Jeffrey Epstein's former cellmate who claims to have saved Epstein from a hanging suicide attempt. His professional contact information for the Federal Bureau of Prisons is included.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the forwarded news article; described as a multimillionaire sex offender whose cellmate claims to have saved him from a hanging suicide attempt.

connections.description: Thomas was Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and claims to have saved him from a hanging suicide attempt.

events.title: Email about Epstein cellmate's claim
events.description: An email is sent forwarding a news article in which Michael Thomas, Epstein's ex-cop cellmate, claims to have saved Epstein from a hanging suicide attempt.

events.title: Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in cell
events.description: Michael Thomas claims he saved multimillionaire sex offender Jeffrey Epstein from a hanging suicide attempt while they were cellmates.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Michael Thomas, identified as Jeffrey Epstein's ex-cop cellmate, claims to have saved Epstein from a hanging suicide attempt.
The claim is circulated via email on July 27, 2019, shortly before Epstein's death in August 2019.
Michael Thomas was a Material Handler Supervisor for the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The document provides Thomas's official professional contact information within the DOJ/FBOP system.
